description: Here, the reinforcement learning specific data of assume will be plotted. Especially the process during the learning

options.content: # Welcome to Learning Dashboard by ASSUME

## How to Use the Dashboard  

This interactive tool provides insights into the learning process of our reinforcement learning (RL) agent. While the TensorBoard integration (compare ReadMe) provides an overview of the general learning performance of all agents, this dashboard gives you the option to inspect **each agent individually or in comparison**. To effectively navigate the dashboard, keep the following key points in mind:  

### 1. Dashboard Structure  

The dashboard is divided into two main rows and two columns:  

**COLUMNS**  
- **Training Episode:** Depicts the results of the selected training episodes at the top of the dashboard. Note that training episodes have special properties such as noise added for exploration purposes.  
- **Evaluation Episode:** Depicts the results of the selected evaluation episodes.  

**ROWS**  
- **Per Simulation:** Summarizes results across all simulated episodes, distinguishing between "training" and "evaluation" episodes.  
- **Per Episode:** Focuses on specific units and episodes, allowing for detailed analysis.  

### 2. Selecting Metrics and Simulations  

At the top of the dashboard, you can filter data using the following options:  

- **Simulation ID:** Choose the simulation run you want to analyze.  
- **Unit & Episode:** Select specific units and episodes for detailed insights. You can also select all units, but be cautiousâ€”visualizing a large number of agents may cause performance issues.  

The selected metrics will be displayed in corresponding visualization areas.  

### 3. Interacting with Plots  

The plots are fully interactive:  

- **Zoom** in and out to explore trends.  
- **Click** on data points for detailed values.  
- **Hover** over the upper-left corner of each plot for additional insights.  

### How to Interpret the Data  

To make the most of the dashboard, follow these key steps:  

1. **Understand Learning Trends:**  
   - Observe how **reward** and **profitability** metrics evolve over time.  
   - Look for an upward trend in evaluation runs (where exploration is off). Unlike fluctuating training rewards, evaluation rewards should show a steady increase.  

2. **Analyze Policy & Action Patterns:**  
   - Examine the agent's learned policy and action distribution.  
   - Identify patterns and assess whether they align with

targets.rawSql:
WITH unit_episode_rewards AS (
    SELECT
        episode,
        unit,
        SUM(reward) / COUNT(*) AS average_reward
    FROM rl_params
    WHERE simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+'
      AND learning_mode IS NOT NULL
      AND unit IN (${rl_unit})  
    GROUP BY episode, unit
)
SELECT episode, unit, average_reward
FROM unit_episode_rewards
ORDER BY episode, unit;

WITH unit_episode_rewards AS (
    SELECT
        episode,
        unit,
        SUM(reward) / COUNT(*) AS average_reward
    FROM rl_params
    WHERE simulation ~ '^${simulation}_eval_[1-9]+'
      AND learning_mode IS TRUE
      AND unit IN (${rl_unit})  
    GROUP BY episode, unit
)
SELECT episode, unit, average_reward
FROM unit_episode_rewards
ORDER BY episode, unit;

WITH unit_episode_profits AS (
    SELECT
        episode,
        unit,
        sum(profit)/1000 as profit
    FROM rl_params
    WHERE simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+'
      AND learning_mode IS NOT NULL
      AND unit IN (${rl_unit})  
    GROUP BY episode, unit
)
SELECT episode, unit, profit
FROM unit_episode_profits
ORDER BY episode, unit;

WITH unit_episode_profits AS (
    SELECT
        episode,
        unit,
        sum(profit)/1000 as profit
    FROM rl_params
    WHERE simulation ~ '^${simulation}_eval_[1-9]+'
      AND learning_mode IS TRUE
      AND unit IN (${rl_unit})  
    GROUP BY episode, unit
)
SELECT episode, unit, profit
FROM unit_episode_profits
ORDER BY episode, unit;

SELECT 
    datetime,
    unit, 
    reward
FROM rl_params
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(datetime)  -- Ensuring the query filters by the dashboard's time range
    AND simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+'
    AND learning_mode IS TRUE
    AND unit IN (${rl_unit})  
    AND episode = ${episode}  -- Filtering for the specific episode
ORDER BY datetime, unit;

SELECT 
    datetime,
    unit, 
    reward
FROM rl_params
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(datetime)  -- Ensuring the query filters by the dashboard's time range
    AND simulation ~ '^${simulation}_eval_[1-9]+'
    AND learning_mode IS TRUE
    AND unit IN (${rl_unit})  
    AND episode = ${eval_episode}  -- Filtering for the specific episode
ORDER BY datetime, unit;

SELECT 
    datetime,
    unit, 
    profit / 1000 AS profit
FROM rl_params
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(datetime)  -- Ensuring the query filters by the dashboard's time range
    AND simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+'
    AND learning_mode IS TRUE
    AND unit IN (${rl_unit})  
    AND episode = ${episode}  -- Filtering for the specific episode
ORDER BY datetime, unit;

SELECT 
    datetime,
    unit, 
    profit / 1000 as profit
FROM rl_params
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(datetime)  -- Ensuring the query filters by the dashboard's time range
    AND simulation ~ '^${simulation}_eval_[1-9]+'
    AND learning_mode IS TRUE
    AND unit IN (${rl_unit})  
    AND episode = ${eval_episode}  -- Filtering for the specific episode
ORDER BY datetime, unit;

SELECT 
    datetime,
    unit, 
    actions_0 as noisy_action_0,
    actions_1 as noisy_action_1,
    actions_1 - exploration_noise_1 as action_1,
    actions_0 - exploration_noise_0 as action_0
FROM rl_params
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(datetime)  -- Ensuring the query filters by the dashboard's time range
    AND simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+'
    AND learning_mode IS TRUE
    AND unit IN (${rl_unit})  
    AND episode = ${episode}  -- Filtering for the specific episode
ORDER BY datetime, unit;

SELECT 
    datetime,
    unit, 
    actions_0,
    actions_1
FROM rl_params
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(datetime)  -- Ensuring the query filters by the dashboard's time range
    AND simulation ~ '^${simulation}_eval_[1-9]+'
    AND learning_mode IS TRUE
    AND unit IN (${rl_unit})  
    AND episode = ${eval_episode}  -- Filtering for the specific episode
ORDER BY datetime, unit;

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT
SUBSTRING(m.simulation, 0, LENGTH(m.simulation) +1  - strpos(REVERSE(m.simulation),'_')) AS market_simulation
FROM rl_params m
where perform_evaluation is False and learning_mode is True
list.description: Can choose which simulation we want to show

list.name: simulation
list.query:
SELECT DISTINCT
SUBSTRING(m.simulation, 0, LENGTH(m.simulation) +1  - strpos(REVERSE(m.simulation),'_')) AS market_simulation
FROM rl_params m
where perform_evaluation is False and learning_mode is True

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT unit
FROM rl_params
where simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+'
list.description: All units that have an reinforcment learning strategy and hence have the Rl specific parameteres logged
list.label: Unit
list.name: rl_unit
list.query:
SELECT DISTINCT unit
FROM rl_params
where simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+'

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT episode
FROM rl_params
WHERE simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+' 
AND learning_mode IS True
ORDER BY episode;
list.label: Episode
list.name: episode
list.query:
SELECT DISTINCT episode
FROM rl_params
WHERE simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+' 
AND learning_mode IS True
ORDER BY episode;

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT episode
FROM rl_params
WHERE simulation ~ '^${simulation}_eval_[1-9]+'
  AND learning_mode IS TRUE
ORDER BY episode;
list.label: Eval. episode
list.name: eval_episode
list.query:
SELECT DISTINCT episode
FROM rl_params
WHERE simulation ~ '^${simulation}_eval_[1-9]+'
  AND learning_mode IS TRUE
ORDER BY episode;

title: ASSUME: Training progress
